reviews.review_msg: Doesn't want students to do well. Never accommodating to student's questions- no straight answer  Midterms and exam are extremely specific with  80 + pages to study for the exams. They gave us two topics in one week to make students self-teach to make up for the Reconciliation holiday. Doesn't post lectures and TA does not stick to office hours.

Lectures can be dry and monotonous but they are extremely necessary to pass the class. This class may as well be called 'Analyzing Risk Assessments'. Lots of hard work and I didn't have much fun but Adam is cool and very knowledgeable.

I really enjoyed taking psyc 379 with this great prof. he is really knowledgeable not only about the course content but also about how to clearly teach them to the students. He is definitely one of the best prof at SFU , and I would take more courses with him.

Dr. Blanchard is a great prof! His lectures can be a bit dry but really informative - AND HE PRE-RECORDED IT which was great. Exams are medium difficulty and so as the paper. Online discussions via canvas is also an easy mark to get. Easily one of the best profs I ever had although it was remote learning.

Dr. Douglas is such an excellent professor - highly recommend taking any of his classes! His lectures are really good and he shares a ton of interesting stories. He provides access to all the textbooks, chapters, readings for free and his grading criteria is clear for assignments - 1 midterm, 1 project and a final exam - and he curves the grades.

Kevin is awesome! Incredibly knowledgeable, fair, and engaging. His expectations from students are always very clear and transparent, and he never tries to "trick" the class when it comes to exams or assignments. I don't think you could find a better professor for forensic psych at SFU- I would highly recommend taking any course you can with him!

One of the best psych profs at SFU in my opinion. Course content is definitely a bit challenging, end of term assignment is brutal in terms of workload but quite fun to do. His lectures are great and he adds humor to such a heavy topic. Would recommend it other than the fact that it's an 8:30 class but id say 50% of classes are online so its okay

Kevin is a great prof. However, we were only graded in the class by two exams and an assignment. So everything is weighed pretty heavily. The content itself is not challenging though and really enjoyable.

The final assignment was really straightforward, easy, and actually interesting! You get to choose between a HCR assessment with a lit review or a term paper. Lectures were engaging and actually interesting, and is true to what the SFU course description says, unlike some other courses at SFU. Overall, this was my fave course at SFU.

I really enjoyed this class with Kevin! Exams can be difficult as you're tested on scientific journal articles, but the class is curved so you'll end up doing really well if you put in the effort. He's a great lecturer - very funny and engaging.

Kevin is a great teacher. Makes lectures fun and interesting. Must attend class as his slides are vague which he expands on in class. Tests are fair and non-cumulative with 1 term paper you can write about almost anything highly recommend

I loved his class. Kevin is a great professor. He is so real and he does a good job explaining the concepts. I didn't have too much of a forensic background but I genuinely enjoyed his class. Make sure you go to lecture since half of his notes are not on the powerpoints and do your readings! Probably one of my favourite classes of my undergrad!

Oh. My. God. KD is the BEST PROFESSOR. I am so inspired by his achievements and overall amazing personality, taking this course made me want to succeed. He is unbelievably helpful and so extremely clear with his course content. He really cares about the field and will go the extra mile to help his students, discussions are always encouraged. Do it!
Brilliant, interesting, interested, relevant, current, experienced, available ...... Amazing prof.
Great prof! Very interesting stories. Final project is fun (risk assessment). lectures are a must and exams are fair but a little harder gotta study.. Loved this class highly recommended

I went into this class not knowing what to expect. Kevin is very engaging and keeps the topics interesting. The exams are hard and asks about details in the readings, but as long as you pay attention in class & do the readings, you'll be fine. the grades are scaled too. Loved this class.

Jodi is so caring and sweet, but also crazy successful and inspirational. Check out her cv, damn. I learned the most out of this course than any other in my entire degree, and it inspired me to pursue clinical forensic. She knows how to keep people engaged and interested - and has interesting stories of cases she's worked on :)

By far the best prof I've ever had - super kind and super genuine. No textbook, just online readings. Exams were based on readings and lecture material, and were fairly easy if you studied hard enough. Paper & risk assessment report were simple, as the criteria was explicitly laid out. 100% recommend this course to everyone, even non-psych majors!

The structure is very hard to follow (lecture, readings). Teacher is poor at making things explicit and clear in his expectations. Overall, what was suppose to be a very interesting course ended up to be the least appeciated Psyc course at SFU. Although if you are able to grasp his intentions, then maybe you can do better than me.
Not very nice.

This TA comes off unprofessional. I asked her if she could post the slides before class, especially being connected to CAL and she agreed and said she'd have them done anyway since she teacher a class before this one. Not only did she NOT share them before class, she'd do it sometimes a day or so after and complains we're not paying attention.
Extremely rude and snarky it's kind of strange and highly unprofessional.
She appears friendly in class but soon as spoken to privately she gets quite rude. It's confusing.
very critical and judgmental on personal appearances and ethnicity. Harsh and rude generally if you're not a native Canadian.

One of the worst.  Very racist, will be nice to you only if u are native! 
 We were asked to rate her , which she handed in herself. And we were asked to write with pencil which she erased and marked different numbers. After which we had to openly tell the prof,  and she ended marking us so bad. luckily my other exams were marked by my prof

Will bark research at you and expect you to understand. Doesn't know how to break down key concepts or research into digestible content. Exams are very difficult - no study guide, and so much info/research covered throughout course you'd need to memorize every little detail of lectures and texts. Also very condescending??

Madison is great! I enjoyed clinical forensic psyc with her, she incorporated a lot of research (as necessary), but the content was interesting. The project throughout the semester applied to course content and honestly was one of the best parts of the course! The exams are quite difficult, but I wouldn't say it is a major deterrent!

Hart is a person with great humor and personality, very knowledgeable and apporachable. However, his exam is more difficult than he desciribed: you need to read a lot and pay attention on all key concepts for the fill-blank and short answer questions. Final is much easier but requires heavier readings. overall, recommend.

I realized I screwed up my course sections on my last post. I took 268 with him not 250, and the last class I took with Hart was 379. Basically he teaches the Forensic Psyc classes! Seriously choose Hart over Deb Connolly!

This guy is fantastic! His class is by no means an easy grade, but it's challenging and interesting. I learned a lot not just from his fantastic stories, but his great explanation of important points. Easily one of the professors I've had throughout University!
Absolutely amazing. He's hilarious!!! Best professor at SFU!

Hart is great, you don't want to miss having him as a prof at some point while you're at SFU. Sometimes it feels more like you're watching stand-up than a lecture (in a good way). I found it pretty hard to get a decent mark in this class, and there were also issues around tests and marking in general. It was a GPA hurter for me but it was worth it.

Dr. Hart is one of the best lecturers at SFU. Unfortunately, this class was a disappointment. He didn't cover any of the material on the final in lecture. Instead, we got guest lectures on material that we had already been tested on, (coincidentally, his research area). We had to learn everything by ourselves from dense, theory-rich articles. C+.
